answers.answer: The echo reveals some enlargement of the right side of your heart with mildly incrased pressure. These findings alone would not be sufficient to explain your severe symptoms. An undetected abnormality on the echocardiogram, such as valve disease that was not properly visualized, could account for the abnormalities on the echo and your symptoms. A stress echocardiogram will also be useful.
